page.title: 13CHOSLEY FARM AREA
page.content: About a mile north of the main Alton road in the direction of Greywell is Chosley Farm. The primary land cover is intensively managed grassland. Some corn, barley and wheat are grown in the fields. The secondary land cover is enclosed rough, grazing land, for livestock on the farm. There is a herd of Jersey cows and sheep which are reared for their meat and wool. A small number of chickens are kept. Chosley Farm has two farm buildings, four barns, and two garages. A side track with a concrete surface, leads from Greywell into Odiham. There are neither houses nor shops in this area. Located in the area is the site of a prehistoric and Romano-British village.
